Key Match Events: Kolo Muani's shot was deflected by Jan Vertonghen, resulting in an own goal that sent France to the quarter-final.
France defender Jules Koundé was named Player of the Match for his strong defense and contributions to attacking areas.
Belgium's Mangala received a yellow card in the 90+2 minute.
Belgium's Vertonghen received a yellow card in the 75th minute.
France's Griezmann received a yellow card in the 24th minute.
France's Tchouameni received a yellow card in the 14th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: This match marked the 76th meeting between France and Belgium.
France had won all four of their previous major tournament matches against Belgium.
The last time France and Belgium met in the Euros was in 1984, where France won 5-0 in the group stage.
France had scored only two goals in the Euro 2024 group stage, their fewest in a major tournament group stage since the 2010 World Cup.
Belgium had reached the knockout stages of the Euros for the third consecutive time and had won their last four last-16 games in major tournaments.
